title: bukiyou_na_senpai
body:
Romcom manga series by [[Kudou Makoto]]. Follows an awkward and serious [[office lady]] named [[Kannawa Azusa]] as she clumsily tries to express her feelings to her friendly and outgoing junior [[Kamegawa Yuu]] without being too obvious.

Originally released as a webcomic on Pixiv and Twitter before being picked up for publication in [[Young Gangan]].

Set in the same continuity as the mangaka's other work, [[HG ni Koisuru Futari]].

Officially published in English as [b]My Awkward Senpai[/b] on "Comikey":[https://comikey.com/comics/my-awkward-senpai-manga/].

title: chiba_mamoru
body:
The male protagonist from the manga and anime [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] (aka. Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon) by [[Takeuchi Naoko]]. He is the major romantic interest of [[Tsukino Usagi]], yet at the beginning of the series, both he and Usagi were on sour terms- and went out of their way to insult one another.

A car accident blocked his childhood and current memories, but opened up the memories of his previous life as Prince [[Endymion (sailor moon)|]]. This gave him visions of a girl ([[Princess Serenity]]) he was determined to find.

He is often portrayed as stoic, steady and introverted. And jumps at the opportunity to help others. Even as a civilian he has a variety of abilities and physical talents.
[b]-Wikipedia-[/b]

Voiced by [[Furuya Tooru]] in the 90s anime, and [[Nojima Kenji]] in Crystal.

h4. See also

* [[Tuxedo Kamen]]

title: mad_scientist_gremory
body:
Character from [[Guardian Tales]].

Gremory is a research scientist from the devildom. Her life is solely dedicated to researching magic.

Her mind largely deviates from that of an ordinary person. She often gets trapped in her own thoughts in any time and place. She would start talking to oneself in middle of conversations or burst into endless ravings about her crazy research ideas.

To Gremory's eyes, everyone is an experimental subject. No once can predict what will happen to a subject in her lab or whether the subject will be able to see the sun again for that matter.

title: druid_kanna
body:
Character from [[Guardian Tales]].

Kanna is a rare white tiger anthromorph among the already rare tiger anthromorphs. Tiger anthromorphs are born in their tiger form. When they begin to realize their abilities, they can change freely between their tiger and human forms at will. Kanna also had a hard time changing into her human form at first, but she can now change freely from practicing. She can even transform only certain body parts as well. Kanna usually stays as a tiger, but she fell in love with using human objects after coming to Heavenhold. Now she stays in her human form instead.

She's Kang's older sister, and loves her little brother very much. There are only a few Tiger anthromorphs, and they have strong family bonds. However, Kanna's love for Kang is quite eccentric even for the rare white tiger anthromorphs. Kanna taught her little brother how to take his first steps and guided him on his first hunt. She came to Heavenhold because Kang had followed the Knight there first. She's always watching Kang from a distance, but rarely Intervenes. She believes personal growth can only be achieved by overcoming threats.

Kanna calls herself an exceptional Druid, but everyone else seems to think differently. Everyone rather believes the title of 'Super Anthromorph' is more fitting because of her amazing grip strength. She loves animals and plants. Despite Kanna's love, all the animals are afraid of her and the plants she raises end up wilting. Kanna severely injured a cute puppy by accident from petting it. After the incident, she claims she can only watch the cute and lovely animals from afar and does so. Kanna still calls herself a 'Druid' because of her ability to tame predators. No matter how ferocious, a loving and 'powerful' embrace from Kanna turns them into gentle lambs. 

Everyone can tell Kanna's strength is what definitely makes the predators submit. But no one has objected to Kanna's claim that she's a Druid because she can transform freely from beast and human form and tame predators.

title: batsugun
body:
[i][b]Batsugun[/b][/i] is a 1993 [[science fiction]] vertically scrolling "bullet hell" [[arcade]] [[video game]] originally developed and published by [[Toaplan]] in [[Japan]] and published in Europe by [[Taito]], as well as in [[Korea]] by Unite Trading. 

The last shoot 'em up created by Toaplan, the title takes place on a distant Earth-like planet where a global takeover operative led by king Renoselva A. Gladebaran VII is set into motion, as players assume the role from one of the six fighter pilots conforming the Skull Hornets squadron taking control of submersible jets in a last-ditch effort to overthrow the invading military force from the planet. 

Its gameplay mainly consists of shooting mixed with role-playing game-esque elements using a main two-button configuration.

Headed by Fire Shark designer Tataka Yuko, Batsugun was created by most of the same team that previously worked on several projects at Toaplan and who would later go on to join one of its offshoots after the company declared bankruptcy in 1994 to continue working in the bullet hell sub-genre. 

Though first launched for the arcades, the game was later ported to the [[Sega Saturn]] by Gazelle and published exclusively in Japan by [[Banpresto]] on 25 October 1996, featuring various changes and additions compared with the original version.

Batsugun garnered positive reception from during its initial release in arcades but was later met with mixed critical reception on the Saturn as an import title. Nevertheless, the game garnered awards from Gamest magazine. It has been heralded by many as the first manic shooter due to its evolution of various gameplay features in the shoot 'em up genre and as an inspiration for other similar titles. 

As of 2019, the rights to the project are owned by Tatsujin, a company founded in 2017 by former Toaplan member Yuge Masahiro and now-affiliate of Japanese arcade manufacturer exA-Arcadia alongside many other Toaplan IPs.

title: daopao
body:
Daopao is one of the traditional costumes of Taoism, but it was also the main style of casual wear and dress for scholars in the Ming Dynasty, so Daopao was not necessarily used as all Taoist costumes.

Daopao is a long outer garment with a cross collar and large sleeves, and a concealed Bai on both sides of the garment. The collar edge is wide and a collar guard is usually added. Daopao is larger than Zhiduo and Zhishen of the same size, especially the hem is wider.

title: itadori_yuuji
body:
[[Itadori Yuuji]] is the protagonist of [[Jujutsu Kaisen]]. [[Itadori Yuuji|Yuuji]] grew up in Sendai but soon moved to Tokyo to enroll in the Tokyo Jujutsu High School. There, he is a first-year student at the school where he goes on missions with his classmates. He learns about controlling his curse powers and the cursed spirit inside him.

Through this, he is able to liberate people and areas from curses that are attacking them. The other side to [[Itadori Yuuji|Yuuji]] is [[ryoumen_sukuna_(jujutsu_kaisen)|Sukuna]], the King of All Curses who possesses him.

h4. Appearance
He has [[brown eyes]] and [[undercut]] [[pink hair]]. After consuming [[ryoumen_sukuna_(jujutsu_kaisen)|Sukuna's]] finger, he now has two [[facial mark|facial markings]] below his eyes. The powerful curse also occasionally manifests as [[extra_mouth|extra mouths]] on [[Itadori Yuuji|Yuji’s]] body that [[ryoumen_sukuna_(jujutsu_kaisen)|Sukuna]] talks through. These terrifying mouths can appear under his eyes or even on his hand. 

h4. See also

* [[ryoumen_sukuna_(jujutsu_kaisen)|Ryoumen Sukuna]]

title: journey_(shounen_jump)
body:
The logo/pseudo-mascot of [[Shounen Jump]]. It's half of a pirate's head up to the mustache, and has sometimes been portrayed as a full-bodied pirate with no mouth. A younger spinoff of the pirate named "KAIZO-kun":https://twitter.com/jumpfesta serves as the mascot of Jump Festa.

Many jokes have been made about the fact that the pirate "looks like a young girl":http://gifjpg.blog17.fc2.com/blog-entry-276.html when turned 70 degrees (as in post #854325), leading fanartists to adopt the "girl" version as the logo for parody works (such as post #1860850). Eventually, Jump itself adopted this version of the logo as the mascot of their "Jump J-Books" novel imprint, naming her "Jamie".

h4. See also

* [[List of Official Mascots]]

title: pringles
body:
An American brand of [[potato chips|potato-based chips]] first introduced in 1967 by the company Procter & Gamble. They are produced in a uniform stackable "saddle" shape and sold in [[pringles can|tubes]] instead of bags. 

Unlike normal potato chips which are created using slices of potato, Pringles are created from a dough made from potato flakes that are shaped and fried. Legally in the United States they are not considered potato chips because of this, but are instead legally labeled as a [i]crisp[/i] (not to be confused with the UK term which refers to chips, and where they use the legal label of chip instead of crisp).

On Danbooru, used to refer to any Pringle-style chip, unless another brand is shown, such as the Japanese brand of stackable potato chips known as [[Chip Star]].

h4. See also

* [[Pringle duck]]
* [[Julius Pringles]] - Pringles' mascot

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pringles":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pringles]

title: skyrocket
body:
A skyrocket is a type of [[fireworks]] that uses a solid-fuel [[rocket]] to rise quickly into the sky and upon reaching it's apex sets off a last effect, such as exploding into stars, crackles, or bangs.   They use a variety of means to stabilize their flight, with one common one being a long stick affixed alongside the rocket motor.  The smallest of these types of rockets are referred to as a bottle rocket, as one way of launching them is to secure them in place by resting their stick in the opening of a bottle.

h4. See also

* [[Water rocket]] (a rocket also known as a "bottle rocket")

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Skyrocket":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skyrocket]

title: bottle_rocket
body:
An ambiguous term. Instead use:

* [[Skyrocket]], a fireworks made from a solid-fuel [[rocket]].  The smallest type are commonly referred to as "bottle rockets."
* [[Water rocket]], a rocket commonly made of plastic bottles launched using water and pressurized air.  Also sometimes called a "bottle rocket."

title: twitching_pussy
body:
Rhythmic contractions of the vaginal muscles, visualized as a pulsing of the female genitals.

Describes a clenching motion of the vagina seen when a character is aroused, during or after vaginal penetration, this most commonly occurs during orgasm. The biological reason for these contractions during orgasm are to massage the penis and encourage ejaculation into the vagina, increasing the likelihood of impregnation.

The vaginal contractions may be seen directly with an internal view of the vaginal canal or externally with a character spreading their labia, or after sex with gaping, showing their vaginal opening clenching. These contractions may also be shown "indirectly" with a pulsing motion of the vulva around a penetrating object or body part.

title: gachimuchi_de_dosukebe_na_kateikyoushi_no_oniisan_to_sugosu_natsu
body:
Developed by SKSKdan, Gachimuchi de dosukebe na kateikyoushi no oniisan to sugosu natsu also known as Gachi-Natsu is an LGBT [[Bara]] visual novel illustrated by [[wasp_(anthyutena)|Wasp]].

[b]"It was a sweltering hot day when I met that man."[/b]

[[Ryota Hibiki]] failed the university entrance exam and is trying again.
His tutor, [[Atsushi Kenzaki]], appears before him.

[[Atsushi Kenzaki|Atsushi]] says he will live at [[Ryota Hibiki|Ryota’s]] house during the summer vacation and teach him how to study. Although surprised at this sudden turn of events, living together with a good-looking, stocky guy….
[[Ryota Hibiki|Ryota]] is excited that there may be a little joy in his life.

But! [[Atsushi Kenzaki|Atsushi]] was a cock-loving, energetic, maximalist, and dirty tutor!
Erotic things happen all the time!

[b]What the hell is going to happen this summer!?[/b]

h4. External Links

"Official website":[https://skskdan.com]
"Twitter account":[https://twitter.com/SKSKdan69]
"Pixiv account":[https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2926078]

title: ryota_hibiki
body:
Main character of [[gachimuchi_de_dosukebe_na_kateikyoushi_no_oniisan_to_sugosu_natsu|Gachimuchi de dosukebe na kateikyoushi no oniisan to sugosu natsu]].

[b]"I hope something good will come of it."[/b]
He failed his college entrance exam and is trying again. His parents followed up but became uncomfortable and he is now living alone out of his parents’ house.

He hopes to pass the exam… but he is not making progress in his studies and is slowly becoming anxious.

He has never kissed or even been on a date before, but a dirty tutor ([[Atsushi Kenzaki]]) changes his whole world.

[b]"Don’t worry. I’ll take the lead."[/b]

He has more than enough experience as a tutor and is a fresh sportsman who is good at both studying and exercising. However, he is a dirty tutor who loves eroticism.

title: durga
body:
Durga, also identified as Adi Parashakti, Devi, Shakti, Bhavani, Parvati, and by numerous other names, is a principal and popular form of [[hinduism|Hindu]] goddess [[Parvati (mythology)|]].

Durga is depicted in the Hindu pantheon as a goddess riding a lion or tiger, with [[extra_arms|many arms]] each carrying a weapon, often defeating the mythical buffalo demon. She appears in Indian texts as the wife of god [i]Shiva[/i], as another form of [i]Parvati[/i] or mother goddess.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durga

title: ride_the_lightning
body: [b][i]Ride the Lightning[/i][/b] is the second studio album of American [[Heavy Metal|thrash metal]] band [[Metallica]]. It was released on July 27, 1984 by Megaforce Records and re-released by Elektra Records on November 19, 1984.

title: master_of_puppets
body:
[b][i]Master Of Puppets[/i][/b] is the third studio album of American [[Heavy Metal|thrash metal]] band [[Metallica]].

It was released on March 3, 1986 through Elektra Records and was met with high critical reception. Master of Puppets is often considered a classic thrash metal album by fans, critics, and the band members themselves alike, and is considered one of the greatest heavy metal albums of all time.

Master of Puppets marks the last recording by bassist [[Cliff Burton]], who was killed in a bus accident while on tour to promote the album.

title: ...and_justice_for_all
body:
[b][i]...And Justice For All[/i][/b] is the fourth studio album of American [[Heavy Metal|thrash metal]] band [[Metallica]].

It was released August 25, 1988 by Elektra Records and was the first album to feature bassist Jason Newsted and the last to feature a writing credit by late bassist [[Cliff Burton]].

title: benito_mussolini
body:
[b]Benito Amilcare Andrea Mussolini[/b] (29 July 1883 – 28 April 1945)

Head of the Italian National Fascist Party and dictator of [[Italy]] during [[World War II]]. Regarded as the world's first fascist leader, Mussolini's ambitions to "restore" the Roman Empire is hindered by his incompetence which leads to his eventual downfall.  He was overthrown by his own government when Italy surrendered and joined the Allies in 1943 and were rescued by the Germans to rule the puppet state until 1945, when he was later executed by resistance members.

He was referred in Italy at the time as "Il Duce" (the Leader), similar to how [[Adolf Hitler]] was referred to as "Fuehrer".

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Benito Mussolini":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benito_Mussolini

title: misaka_imouto_19090
body:
One of the many clones of [[Misaka Mikoto]] produced as part of the Radio Noise Project, and later repurposed as part of the Level 6 Shift Project to be used as fodder for [[Accelerator_(toaru_majutsu_no_index)|Accelerator]]. 

This specific Sister is distinguishable for being the only one with expressive emotions - a result of an attempt by [[Nunotaba Shinobu]] to humanize the Sisters and stop the Level 6 Shift Project by injecting her with an emotional protocol virus. While it was intended to be spread through the rest of the Sisters through the Misaka Network, [[last_order_(toaru_majutsu_no_index)|Last Order]]'s unconscious actions prevented it, rendering 19090 as an odd clone. She can often be seen [[blush|blushing]] or worrying about her figure, usually by lifting her shirt and measuring her waist.

title: lifeguard_yuze
body:
Yuze! This summer, she's the lifeguard in charge of safety on the beach!

Upon hearing the news about rising injuries on the beach when it's supposed to be a fun vacation spot during the sweltering summer, Succubus Adventurer Yuze took on the role of a lifeguard. Even when there aren't any accidents happening, the sight of Yuze standing on the lifeguard tower overseeing the beach with binoculars makes it feels as if dangers in and out of the water disappear. If an accident really does happen, Yuze will rush to the scene. Whether they're on the sands, in the middle of the ocean, or deep underwater she always rescues those in danger. Yuze will not stop, no matter how sweaty or wet she gets! Thanks to her, people struck by 'someone' while on a stroll or swimmers flailing in the water because of a sudden grenade launched by 'someone' are able to make it to safety.

She uses her monster-handling skills and powerful grip as an adventurer to face off against the dangers without any hesitation, whether it's a shark or Sohee. Her specially enchanted lifebuoy aids those she rescues by giving them a speedy recovery with healing spells and makes suppressing threats easier with offensive spells.

Yuze takes her role as a lifeguard with utmost seriousness, but can't just understand why she's gathering more energy faster compared to when she streams her adventures on NewTube. The conclusion Yuze could come up with was: 'the scenes of rescue are direr compared to adventuring on NewTube, so that's why they must be more popular.' There's been a shortage of lifeguards on the beach ever since Sohee emerged, but when Yuze started volunteering as a lifeguard, more people recently started signing up for the task as well. Luckily, safety and danger on the beach now hold a frail balance, and the beach became an enjoyable vacation spot for many once again

body:

[spoilers]She impersonates [[Monica von Ochs]] after killing her in Three Houses, allowing her to assassinate [[Jeralt Reus Eisner]]. She is then subsequently defeated by [[Byleth_(fire_emblem)|Byleth]] and sacrificed by [[solon_(fire_emblem)|Solon]] in a failed attempt to banish Byleth to another dimension.[/spoilers]

Has [[short_hair|short]] [[orange hair]], [[red eyes]], [[grey skin]], and [[large breasts]]. She's typically seen wearing a [[revealing_clothes|revealing]] [[black leotard]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[thighhighs]], and wields a [[dagger]] called Athame.

body:

He is also the adoptive father/mentor of Kyle and Cindy - two main characters of the sequel [i]Dimensional Chaser[/i].

title: armor_gigas
body:
A giant suit of [[knight]]-like [[full armor]] wielding a [[greatsword]]. [[Weiss Schnee]] fought it in the [i][[RWBY]][/i] "[i]"White":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vt9vl8iAN5Q][/i]" trailer, adapted for the manga Chapter 3.

[spoiler]In the animation, Weiss eventually learns to summon its arm and greatsword, and later the whole Knight, using her Semblance. The manga reveals that the armor is actually inhabited and controlled by "a possession-type [[Grimm (rwby)|]]" similar to the [[geist_(rwby)|Geist]]. Like the Grimm, it fades after being defeated.[/spoiler]

Volume 4 DVD Commentary reveals its official name to be "Armor Gigas."

title: knight_(rwby)
body:
A giant suit of [[knight]]-like [[full armor]] wielding a [[greatsword]]. [[Weiss Schnee]] fought it in the [i][[RWBY]][/i] "[i]"White":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vt9vl8iAN5Q][/i]" trailer, adapted for the manga Chapter 3.

[spoiler]In the animation, Weiss eventually learns to summon its arm and greatsword, and later the whole Knight, using her Semblance. The manga reveals that the armor is actually inhabited and controlled by "a possession-type [[Grimm (rwby)|]]" similar to the [[geist_(rwby)|Geist]]. Like the Grimm, it fades (armor and all) after being defeated.[/spoiler]

Volume 4 DVD Commentary reveals its official name to be "[[Armor Gigas]]."

title: tall_lady_shopping_in_japanese_store_(meme)
body:
Tall Lady Shopping In Japanese Store refers to an image of a tall woman, purportedly Canadian volleyball player Sarah Pavan, standing at the checkout counter of a [[Don Quijote (store)|]] store in Japan, looking significantly taller than the cashier standing in front of her. The image was posted to DeviantArt in 2018 and became the subject of redraws over the following years.

h4. External links

title: nichol_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Nichol[/b] (ナハト, [i]Nacht[/i]) is a capturable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

CV: [[Hamada Kenji]] (JP), Walden James (EN)

Nichol is a knight of Nohr. Despite being apathetic to most things in the world, Nichol has an unusually strong will to survive. An unused bit of voiced dialogue reveals he fears death above all else.

Nichol appears as the boss of [[sophie_(fire_emblem)|Sophie]]'s Paralogue. Due to his name being mentioned among the names of characters that can only marry [[Corrin (Fire Emblem)|the Avatar]], as well as having critical cut-in portraits, Nichol may have been intended to be a fully-fledged playable character in earlier stages of the game.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Malig Knight

title: little_blue_whale_(kancolle)
body:
The little [[whale]] that usually accompanies [[samuel b. roberts (kancolle)|Samuel B. Roberts]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. A whale of indeterminate species (most probably a [[blue whale]]) with a [[cross scar]] usually found near its left eye. It officially has not been given a name.

This whale is a reference to the whale that the historical USS [i]Samuel B. Roberts[/i] collided in 1944, damaging the propeller shaft and causing the historical destroyer to go back to Norfolk, Virginia for repairs. Historical reports did not elaborate on the species of whale.

title: mishaguji
body:
Mishaguji are [[snake]]-like gods in Japanese folktales.

In [[Touhou]],  Mishaguji are underlings of [[Moriya Suwako]] and have an appearance close to the mythology. They can be seen in [[Touhou Hisoutensoku]] during one of her super moves, where she summons them to assault the opponent in a manner similar to the [[Shun Goku Satsu]]. They also betrayed [[Yasaka Kanako]] when she seized Suwako's land in the distant past, blighting the region until Kanako agreed to keep Suwako as a co-deity. They are utterly loyal to Suwako and will answer to no one else, with the possible exception of Suwako's descendant, [[Kochiya Sanae]].

In [[Megami Tensei]], Mishaguji is a god of sexual intercourse and had a phallic shape, possibly similar to an earthworm.

h4. External links

* "Megami Tensei Wiki: Mishaguji":[https://megamitensei.fandom.com/wiki/Mishaguji]
* "Wikipedia: Mishaguji":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mishaguji]

title: about:embedded_notes
body:
Embedded notes are different from regular notes in that they are opaque and have no border, plus they can have several styles applied to them. h5. Enable/Disable In the edit mode on posts, there is a checkbox "Embed notes". Unchecking this option and saving the post will turn this option on or off. There is also a bookmarklet on forum #136193 which allows one to enable/disable embedded notes without having to enter the post edit menu. h5. Usage The border and opacity of an embedded note vary depending upon its current status. [table] [thead] [tr] [td]Status[/td] [td]Opacity[/td] [td]Border[/td] [/tr] [/thead] [tbody] [tr] [td]Normal[/td] [td]Full[/td] [td]None[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]Normal + Hover[/td] [td]Full[/td] [td]Black[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]Unsaved[/td] [td]N/A[/td] [td]Red[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]Movable[/td] [td]Minimal[/td] [td]blue[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]Movable + Hover[/td] [td]Full[/td] [td]blue[/td] [/tr] [/tbody] [/table] Opening up the edit menu of any note will cause the opacity for all notes on the page to go minimal. h5#styling. Styling Styles can be applied to the embedded notes box by using the CSS class "note-box-attributes". Allowed styles applied to an element with this class will apply the styles to the outer note box. It's best to use an empty element to avoid apply the same styles twice to inner text. h6. Allowed styles * [code]background-color[/code] - Sets the background color the box. * [code]border-radius[/code] - Sets the radiuses of the 4 box corners. "[1]":[#dtext-external-links] * [code]transform[/code] - Applies a transformation to the box. "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] ** The only allowed transformation is a rotation. * [code]justify-content[/code] - Sets the horizontal alignment of inner containers. "[3]":[#dtext-external-links] ** [b]flex-start[/b] - Left alignment. ** [b]flex-end[/b] - Right alignment. ** Not the same as "text-align", which is used to set the text alignment of an inner container. ** [tn][b]Note:[/b] Without this the note box defaults to a center alignment.[/tn] * [code]align-items[/code] - Sets the vertical alignment of inner containers. "[4]":[#dtext-external-links] ** [b]flex-start[/b] - Top alignment. ** [b]flex-end[/b] - Bottom alignment. ** [tn][b]Note:[/b] Without this the note box defaults to a center alignment.[/tn] h6. Template [code]
[/code] h6. Examples [code]
[/code] h5. Stacking order Since embedded notes are opaque, there is the possibility that one note box could cover up a portion of another box, to include the text in that box. However, the order of which box goes over which can be controlled by adding an additional class to the [code]note-box-attributes[/code] element: [code]level-1[/code], [code]level-2[/code], [code]level-3[/code], [code]level-4[/code], [code]level-5[/code]. A box with a higher level will be placed over a box with a lower level, e.g. a [code]level-2[/code] note box would be seen above a [code]level-1[/code] note box. [tn][b]Caveat:[/b] Note boxes without a level set are at the lowest level, almost like a level 0.[/tn] h6. Examples [code]
[/code] h5. Alignment As mentioned under the [b]Styling[/b] section "above":[#dtext-styling], [code]align-items[/code] and [code]justify-content[/code] can be used to set the placement of the text containers inside the note box, since by default, the text containers are aligned towards the center of the note box. In order to get this to work properly, the text containers must be block elements, which can be achieved by either surrounding the text with a [code]
[/code] text container, or by choosing another HTML container tag (e.g. [code][/code]) and setting the [b]display[/b] style to "block". To set the horizontal alignment of the text inside the text containers, you must also use a block text container and set the [code]text-align[/code] style property to either [b]left[/b], [b]right[/b], [b]center[/b], or [b]justify[/b]. "[5]":[#dtext-external-links] h6. Examples [code]
Text in a block text container.
[/code] [code] Text in a block text container. [/code] h6. title: miyauchi_renge
body:
One of [[Non Non Biyori]]'s main characters.

She has [[red eyes|red]]/[[brown eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] that is usually tied into [[twintails]] with [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]] and [[antenna hair]]. Frequently depicted with a [[chestnut mouth]].

She's a first grader, full of energy most of the time and loves to come up with silly ideas, like her "[[Nyanpassu~]]" greeting that is used a few times in the show amongst other things.

Also family of [[Miyauchi Kazuho]] and [[Miyauchi Hikage]].

She is voiced in the anime by [[Koiwai Kotori]].

title: koshigaya_natsumi
body:
A main character from [[Non Non Biyori]]. Voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[blue eyes]], and [[brown hair|brown]]/[[orange hair]] with a [[short ponytail]]. She also wears the [[Asahigaoka school uniform]] when attending school. She's taller than her very short older sister [[Koshigaya Komari]], but shorter than the younger but overdeveloped [[Ichijou Hotaru]]. 

She is a bad student and a troublemaker compared to her more straight-laced sister. She's more emotionally mature than the easily upset Komari, but is childishly irresponsible and often acts lazy. She often pesters her older sister and sometimes treats her like a child; however, deep down she still respects her older sister.

Like [[Miyauchi Renge]], she sometimes calls Komari "Koma-chan"; however, this is generally intended as pestering. Normally she simply calls Komari "onee-chan".

In season one it's revealed that she used to have a childhood crush on her older brother [[Koshigaya Suguru]].

title: koshigaya_komari
body:
Character from [[Non Non Biyori]].

She has [[green eyes]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]], [[antenna hair]], and occasionally, [[two side up]]. She also wears the [[Asahigaoka school uniform]] when attending school. Short and physically underdeveloped for her age, her height is said to be significantly less than 140cm (4'7"), which makes her the second shortest main character despite being the eldest girl. 

[[Miyauchi Renge]] often calls her by her nickname Koma-chan, which she dislikes being called. In spite of her easily upset nature, she's well behaved and a studious student, which contrasts with her lazy younger sister [[Koshigaya Natsumi]].

Voiced by [[Asumi Kana]].

title: ichijou_hotaru
body:
The protagonist of [[Non Non Biyori]].

She has [[brown eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. Although she's a fifth grader, which suggests she's 10-11 years old, she generally appears (especially her [[large breasts]] and height at 164 cm) and acts quite a bit older. Some characters comment on this in the show, but it's never given a clear answer. 

She's very attracted to [[Koshigaya Komari]]. She owns a large and growing collection of self-made [[character doll|stuffed dolls]] of Komari due to her attraction to her.

She is voiced in the anime by [[Murakawa Rie]].

title: scientist_on_the_beach_sohee
body:
Sohee! The super-popular scientist, hitting the beaches this summer!

Sohee never forgot the taste of popularity she briefly enjoyed during her infiltration to Kanterbury high school for the Invader crystal investigation. So she went through a complete makeover based on her research on 'popular women of the summer season' to achieve it once again. She pushed ahead with her weight loss using her new diet machine involving electrical shock and rapid cooling. A fashionable swimsuit and custom-made contact lenses all set, which helped her lose the glasses, and now she's ready to bewitch all those on the beach! Her extremely well-working dieting machine continues to be denied a patent under safety issues, though.

She used her 'try until you succeed' stubbornness and learned how to surf despite her nearly non-existent athletic skills. Sohee is no longer a scientist cooped up in her room doing research and lacking vitamin D, but a strong and powerful one who can wield her modded Magiton Buster surfboard freely. Why would she swing her surfboard around on the beach, nobody knows. Sohee's surfboard is equipped with a Magiton pack, and it quite frequently creates huge waves out of nowhere causing other surfers to wipe out.

Sohee goes out to the beach to show off her makeover only to cause trouble. Ever since Sohee started going around so proudly, more people have been getting injured on the beach. Causes of injuries include: trying to hit on Sohee and getting beaten, being hit by her surfboard while taking a leisurely stroll on the beach, getting swept up by the waves while out surfing nearby, etc. Thanks to her, there are never enough lifeguards around at the beach. Whether Sohee achieved the popularity she wanted so much is unknown, because everyone is usually busy running away from her. Sohee herself seems to be very content with her makeover, so everything is fine except for those who get hurt while hanging around her.

A 2005-10 manga by [[Mizukami Satoshi]], serialized in Shounen Gahosha's [i]Young King OURs[/i]. 

The series follows Amamiya Yuuhi, a college student who wakes up one morning to find a talking lizard who tells him that he is needed to help save the world by finding and protecting the princess and then fighting the enemy trying to destroy the world. title: temperature
body:
Images depicting temperature values or readings.  Commonly in degrees Celsius, but may also be in degrees Fahrenheit or Kelvin.

Celsius scale: A 100 degree scale with 0 degrees water freezing and 100 degrees water boiling.
Fahrenheit scale: A 180 degree scale that is offset 32 degrees, with 32 degrees water freezing and 212 degrees water boiling. 0 degrees being the freezing temperature of a solution of brine.
Kelvin scale: A Celsius derivative scale that is an absolute temperature scale with 0 being the point which enthalpy and entropy of a cooled ideal gas reach their minimum value, also known as absolute zero.  Units are not referred to as degrees like Celsius or Fahrenheit.

h6. Useful temperatures

* Water boiling: 100°C, 212°F, 373.15 K
* Water freezing: 0°C, 32°F, 273.15 K
* Absolute zero: −273.15°C, −459.67°F, 0 K
* Average adult body temperature: 37°C, 98.6°F
* [[Fever]]: 38°C or higher, 100.4°F or higher
* Hypothermia: Below 35°C, Below 95°F
* Very hot day: 35°C or above, 95°F or above
* Average office temperature: 20-24.5°C, 68-76°F
* Jacket Weather: ~10°C, ~50°F

h4. See also

* [[Thermometer]]
* [[Weather]]

title: pedestrian_crossing_sign
body:
A pedestrian crossing sign is a [[road sign]] to alert oncoming traffic that they're either approaching a [[crosswalk]] or they're approaching an area where pedestrians frequently cross the street.

These signs at minimum usually depict a silhouette figure walking and may include the figure walking in a crosswalk.  These signs are similar to [[school crossing sign]]s, which serve a similar purpose but depict the figure of a boy and girl carrying a book in their hands.

h4. See also

* [[Pedestrian lights]]

title: traffic_light
body:
A traffic light (also known as a traffic signal or stoplight) is a signaling device positioned at [[intersection|road intersections]], [[crosswalk]]s, and other locations in order to control the flow of vehicular traffic.  Traffic lights consist normally of three light signals of the colors red, yellow, and green/blue arranged vertically or horizontally in that order.  While this is standardized internationally, variations may exist.

h4. See also

* [[Pedestrian lights]]
* [[Road sign]]
* [[Road]]
* [[Street]]

title: guantanamo_class_stealth_carrier
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] science fiction series.

The [b]Guantanamo Class Stealth Carrier[/b] is an improved version of the old [[ARMD]] Space Carrier with stealth capabilities and its own Space Fold System for interstellar travel. 

As a carrier, the Guantanamo Class has a large launch bay in the forward section, a dock in the aft section of the ship to link with large vessels and large external fuel tanks with stealth covers. 

Though this class of vessel utilized many new technologies, the economy of design proved relatively inexpensive and the [[U.N. Spacy]] (and later the [[N.U.N.S.]]) deployed massive numbers of Guantanamo Stealth Carriers. These ships are found primarily as the main force carrier in the colonization fleets, but the Guantanamo Class Stealth Carrier is also used extensively for planetary defense. 

In [[real life]] this fictional ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the 90s.

title: takamakura
body: A takamakura (literally "tall pillow") is a type of Japanese traditional [[pillow]] consisting of a cylindrical cushion set on top of a tall base. As they can support the neck rather than the skull, they were often used to preserve complex traditional hairstyles ([[nihongami]]) such as those associated with [[geisha]].

title: pachycephalosaurus
body: Pachycephalosaurus, /ˌpækɪˌsɛfələˈsɔːrəs/; meaning "thick-headed lizard", from Greek pachys-/παχύς- "thick", kephale/κεφαλή "head" and sauros/σαῦρος "lizard") is a genus of pachycephalosaurid dinosaurs. The type species, P. wyomingensis, is the only known species. It lived during the Late Cretaceous Period (Maastrichtian stage) of what is now North America. Remains have been excavated in Montana, South Dakota, Wyoming, and Alberta. It was a herbivorous creature which is primarily known from a single skull and a few extremely thick skull roofs, at 22 centimetres (9 inches) thick. More complete fossils have been found in recent years. Pachycephalosaurus was among the last non-avian dinosaurs before the Cretaceous–Paleogene extinction event. The genus Tylosteus has been synonymized with Pachycephalosaurus, as have the genera Stygimoloch and Dracorex in recent studies.
other_names: パキケファロサウルス

title: brontosaurus
body: Brontosaurus (/ˌbrɒntəˈsɔːrəs/; meaning "thunder lizard" from Greek βροντή, brontē "thunder" and σαῦρος, sauros "lizard") is a genus of gigantic quadruped sauropod dinosaurs. Although the type species, B. excelsus, had long been considered a species of the closely related Apatosaurus and therefore invalid, researchers proposed in 2015 that Brontosaurus is a genus separate from Apatosaurus and that it contains three species: B. excelsus, B. yahnahpin, and B. parvus.

title: masuotv
body:
Born in Myoko City, Niigata Prefecture. He is also a childhood friend with YouTuber's Hikakin, and has frequently appeared on Hikakintv before his activities, and then made his debut under requests such as viewers and Hikakin.

He operates two YouTube channels, "MasuotV" and "Masuogames", and posts videos such as product reviews, cooking, massage, everyday, and game commentary. As of February 2022, registrants were 1.8 million, and the total number of views was over 1 billion.

He is an acupuncture and moxibustion massager with three national qualifications: Anma Massage Shiatsu, Harrier, and Kyu, and has worked in a clinic. Taking advantage of that experience, he posts videos that regularly invite YouTuber and entertainers as guests and chat while massaging.

title: medi_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Medi[/b] (マヒル, Mahiru) is a minor character in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends Arceus]][/i]. If the player has a [i][[Pokemon SwSh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i] save file on their Switch, Medi will give a quest involving [[Shaymin]].

Medi has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with a [[short ponytail]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. She wears the [[Diamond Clan outfit]] with [[aqua pantyhose|aqua]] and [[blue pantyhose|blue]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[pantyhose]].

title: calaba_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Calaba[/b] (ユウガオ, Yuugao) is a character in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends Arceus]][/i]. She is a Pearl Clan warden who takes care of [[Ursaluna]].

Calaba is short, has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[white hair|white]] and [[grey hair]], and [[grey eyes]]. She wears the [[Pearl Clan outfit]] with [[purple pantyhose|purple]] and [[aqua pantyhose|aqua]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[pantyhose]]. Calaba also carries a [[basket]] with plants on her back.

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Calaba":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Calaba]

title: tenkuu_shinpan
body:
[b][i]Tenkuu Shinpan[/i][/b], or [b]High-Rise Invasion[/b] in English is a manga series by Tsuina Miura. A [[Netflix]] anime adaptation was released on February 25, 2021. The story is set in an alternate world depicting numerous skyscrapers interconnected by suspension bridges where survivors must face the murderous masked people who are hellbent in bringing despair to any unfortunate victims.

title: kure_kirika
body:
A character from [[Mahou Shoujo Oriko Magica]] and its spin-off stories.

The Black Magical Girl, [[Mikuni Oriko]]'s partner.

Her magical girl outfit consists of a long black coat with [[sleeves_past_wrists|sleeves past her wrists]] and a [[red necktie]], white [[thighhighs]], and an [[eyepatch]] over her right eye.  Her orange [[soul gem]] is on the small of her back.  Her weapons are a pair of [[claws|claws]] that sprout from her wrists.

[spoiler]Has a time-slowing power. She's the one who is responsible in the magical girl killing in [[Mahou Shoujo Oriko Magica]] by order of Oriko.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Her [[witch (madoka magica)|]] form is [[Latria (madoka magica)|]].[/spoiler]

title: kamijou_touma
body:
A character from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]].
He is the main protagonist of the [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]] series and an important character in the [[Toaru Kagaku no Railgun]] series. As a Level 0 Academy City first-year high school student, his point-of-view allows the audience to become acquainted to the mysterious world of Toaru Majutsu no Index, and is mostly involved in the events of its Magic Side.
He possesses the mysterious [[Imagine Breaker]] in his right hand, which is capable of negating all forms of magic, esper powers, and other divine abilities. This, according to [[Index (toaru majutsu no index)|]], even includes his own good luck, as they are the blessings of God.

He has a very strong desire to aid all those who are in need even if it means putting his life on the line and will not hesitate to challenge an opponent who is several times more powerful than himself. Because of his willingness to help others unconditionally, he has attracted the affections of many characters in the series, which Himegami Aisa jokes about, stating that his life is like a dating simulation where he is bound to unlock more paths to more girls

h4. See also

* [[SoGeBu (meme)|]] - A meme involving his signature catchphrase.

title: mahatma_gandhi
body:
Full name: [b]Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi[/b] (2 October 1869 – 30 January 1948) 
[tn]"Mahatma" is an honorific. i.e. "The Venerable Gandhi"[/tn]

title: habanero_pepper
body:
A kind of [[chili pepper]]. As it matures it changes in color. Common colors are orange and red, but white, brown, and pink are also seen. Habaneros are known to be extremely spicy, rated 100,000–350,000 on the Scoville scale.

A "snack food company":http://tohato.jp/products/habanero/ in Japan uses this product to flavor chips that are shaped into rings. The popularity of this product spawned the character [[Habanero-tan]].

title: toaru_majutsu_no_virtual-on
body: In English, [i]A Certain Magical Virtual-On[/i]. A 2018 collaboration/[[crossover]] game between Sega's [i][[Virtual On|Cyber Troopers Virtual-ON]][/i] and Dengeki Bunko's [i][[Toaru Majutsu no Index]][/i] for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation Vita featuring [i]Toaru Majutsu no Index[/i] characters piloting returning Virtuaroids for sport. Compared to the earlier [i]Virtual On[/i] games, it uses a point system instead of a direct fighting game round setup.
other_names: とある魔術の電脳戦機

title: virtual_on
body:
[i][b]Cyber Troopers Virtual-ON[/b][/i], or simply [i]Virtual-ON[/i], is a fast-paced, 3D [[mecha]] fighting game created by [[Sega]]. Many of the series' mechas were designed by Hajime Katoki, one of the mecha designers of the [[Gundam]] franchise. The game puts players in 3D arena where they take control of giant mechas known as Virtuaroids to defeat the other player. When it first debuted in arcades, it used a unique twin-stick set-up to give the players the idea of piloting a giant mecha. The series has seen three sequels and ports on video game consoles. 

Some of the Virtuaroids such Temjin and Fei-Yen have featured in a few games in the [i][[Super Robot Wars]][/i] series; Fei-Yen also been crossed-over with [[Vocaloid]]'s [[Hatsune Miku]] as Fei-Yen HD in [i]Super Robot Wars UX[/i]. In addition, the franchise collaborated with [i][[Toaru Majutsu no Index]][/i] in [i][[Toaru Majutsu no Virtual-On]][/i].

h5.Games in the series includes:

* [i]Cyber Troopers Virtual-ON: Operation Moongate[/i]
* [i]Cyber Troopers Virtual-ON: Oratorio Tangram[/i]
* [i]Cyber Troopers Virtual-ON: FORCE[/i]
* [i]Cyber Troopers Virtual-ON: MARZ[/i]
* [i][[Toaru Majutsu no Virtual-On]][/i]
other_names: 電脳戦機バーチャロン

title: mr._heart
body:
[i]Heart-sama[/i] (ハート様, Mr. Heart) is a minor antagonist from [[Hokuto no Ken]].

The most prominent antagonist among [[shin_(hokuto_no_ken)|Shin]]'s four lieutenants. He is an extremely [[fat]] man. His stomach absorbs the blow of every martial art, except [i]Nanto Sei Ken[/i].  Usually he is gentle and good-natured. But, when he watches blood of his own, he runs berserk with rage and massacres those around him.
He was defeated by [[Kenshiro]], who kicks him with enough force to dissipate all of his fat layer and reaches his fatal pressure points.  His death cry was "[i]Hidebu![/i]." ("[i]Debu[/i]" = "fat man")

Althought being a one-shot villain in the original series, Mr. Heart has gained his own fanbase and later appeared as playable character in several [i]Hokuto no Ken[/i] games.

title: jizou
body: A divinity in Japanese Buddhism most commonly known for being the patron of children, expectant mothers, travelers and pilgrims, firemen, and guardian of children in limbo. The localized version of Ksitigarbha, he is one of the most popular bodhisattva ([i]bosatsu[/i] in Japanese--a person who attains enlightenment but postpones becoming a Buddha in order to help others) of the 16 attendants of Amida Buddha, a savior par exellence of those in need. Statues of male Jizou as a bald monk, standing with one foot slightly forward, with a staff in his right hand to push open the gates of Hell and a pearl or gem in his left to light the darkness, are found in cemeteries and along roadsides, ostensibly to invoke his help and protection.

title: harries_technique
body:
A method of holding a [[handgun]] and a [[flashlight]] simultaneously while keeping the gun steady and the flashlight pointed in the same direction, developed by Michael Harries, a shooting instructor and retired US Marine.

"[T]he flashlight is maintained in an "ice pick" grip while the handgun is thrust forward, at which point the non-shooting hand crosses beneath the handgun-retaining arm. The technique finishes with the backs of the hands against one another, creating isometric tension for stability." ("Source":http://www.iwillnotbeavictim.com/flashlight_hold-page.html)

Examples can be seen "here":http://www.theboxotruth.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/22.jpg, "here":http://www.iwillnotbeavictim.com/sitebuilder/images/jsw_hb_7-291x188.jpg, and "here":http://www.iwillnotbeavictim.com/sitebuilder/images/jsw_hb_6-287x185.jpg.

h4. See also
* [[police]]
* [[handgun]]

Technically this term could apply to [i]any[/i] firearm with an exposed box magazine in different capacities, but the contrast is not nearly so obvious.

title: stakes_of_purgatory
body:
Characters from [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]], seven stakes capable of taking human form, each representing a deadly sin. In keeping with Umineko's various shout-outs to the Divine Comedy, their ages follow the ordering of the terraces in Purgatorio. Their names derive from Peter Binsfeld's classification of demons, which assigns a demon as chief tempter of each of the seven deadly sins. 

Often wearing an [[Angel Mort]]-like [[showgirl skirt]] with a cropped Red [[blazer]].

* [[Lucifer (umineko)|]], stake of pride
* [[Leviathan (umineko)|]], stake of envy
* [[Satan (umineko)|]], stake of wrath
* [[Belphegor (umineko)|]], stake of sloth
* [[Mammon (umineko)|]], stake of greed
* [[Beelzebub (umineko)|]], stake of gluttony
* [[Asmodeus (umineko)|]], stake of lust

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: List of Naku Koro ni characters":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Umineko_no_Naku_Koro_ni_characters#Stakes_of_Purgatory
